AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Population Sciences

Description: This session discusses the potential benefits of using artificial intelligence and real-world data in oncological care to advance cancer research and improve patient outcomes. Data-driven tools can create personalized screening and treatment models, predict adverse events, and guide clinical care. However, integrating these tools across health systems and ensuring equitable benefits across populations remains a challenge. The session aims to highlight successful use cases of the development of equitable digital health technologies in cancer care, offer insights to improve the integration of these tools across systems, and discuss ways to scale and sustain clinical decision support tools in oncological care.
PrimaryCategory: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science
SearchResultBody: SY39. Electronic Health Records and Cancer Learning Health Systems
Title: Electronic Health Records and Cancer Learning Health Systems
